ClsC_cbb6b04e.class_description: Standards providing guidelines and rules for construction and assessment in engineering applications.
ClsC_cbb6b04e.evidence_excerpt: Standards for construction and assessment in engineering.

members.entity_description: Standard for Shell and Tube Heat Exchangers used in general refinery service.
members.resolution_context: Std. 660 is a standard for Shell and Tube Heat Exchangers used in general refinery service.

members.entity_name: ASME Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code Section III
members.entity_description: Rules for construction of nuclear power plant components.
members.resolution_context: ASME Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code Section III, Division I, provides rules for construction of nuclear power plant components.

members.entity_description: Guidance on methods for assessing the acceptability of flaws in fusion welded structures.
members.resolution_context: BSI 7910 provides guidance on methods for assessing the acceptability of flaws in fusion welded structures.

ClsC_130df385.class_description: Mechanisms causing material degradation, including mechanical, metallurgical, and thickness loss processes.
ClsC_130df385.evidence_excerpt: The mechanisms are divided into sections: a) Mechanical and Metallurgical Failure, b) Uniform or Localized Loss of Thickness.

members.entity_description: Failure mechanisms related to mechanical and metallurgical processes in various industries.
members.resolution_context: The mechanisms are divided into the following sections: a) Mechanical and Metallurgical Failure, indicating a category of damage mechanisms common in industries.

members.entity_name: Uniform or Localized Loss of Thickness
members.entity_description: A damage mechanism involving the reduction of material thickness, either uniformly or in specific areas.
members.resolution_context: The mechanisms are divided into the following sections: b) Uniform or Localized Loss of Thickness, suggesting a type of damage mechanism affecting material thickness.

ClsC_27c3240d.class_description: Processes involving the transformation of carbide phases into graphite nodules in steels at elevated temperatures.
ClsC_27c3240d.evidence_excerpt: Transformation of carbide phases into graphite nodules.

members.entity_description: Change in microstructure of carbon and 0.5Mo steels causing loss of strength and ductility.
members.resolution_context: Graphitization is a change in the microstructure of certain carbon steels and 0.5Mo steels after long-term operation in the 800oF to 1100oF range that may cause a loss in strength, ductility, and/or creep resistance.

members.entity_description: Result of carbide phase decomposition in steels at elevated temperatures, forming graphite nodules.
members.resolution_context: Both entities describe the transformation of carbide phases into graphite nodules, indicating they refer to the same concept.

ClsC_86aa4dd9.class_description: Chromium as an alloying element in steel, providing resistance to oxidation, corrosion, and eliminating graphitization.
ClsC_86aa4dd9.evidence_excerpt: Chromium is an alloying element in stainless steels.

members.entity_description: An alloying element in stainless steels that provides resistance to oxidation and corrosion.
members.resolution_context: Chromium is mentioned as an alloying element in stainless steels, contributing to their resistance to oxidation and corrosion.

members.entity_description: Element added to steel to eliminate graphitization.
members.resolution_context: The addition of about 0.7% chromium has been found to eliminate graphitization.
